topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559c85f36368721231000357#post_559c85f36368721231000357
[bq="HJSDGCE"]"@SidewardManatee":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559c855a63687275e0000c36#post_559c855a63687275e0000c36
I wouldn't mind killing lamias, centaurs or harpies for meat.
Well, I would mind if it was just for dinner but if I was desperate and there were either human beings or half humans, I'd eat the harpy first.[/bq]
. . . I'd point out the fact you'd be eating a sapient human level intelligent creature and that would be the equivalent of going out and killing someone's mom for meat.

That always struck me as weird about RPG games cause often times you can eat flesh of sapient talking creatures that are as smart as humans.  Wouldn't going around eating people make you the bad guy?

topics.body:
"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559c87676368721a00002fa6#post_559c87676368721a00002fa6
Now that I think about it a lot of rpg games you're actually playing the villain, cause on the one hand "thank you hero for saving us from the monsters!" but on the other hand "what the flying fuck is wrong with you humans?  You go out hunting for sapient talking species and hunt them and eat them on the basis of 'they don't look human so eating their parents is morally okay'?"

*A LOT* of rpg games you're essentially playing as hannibal lecture or charles manson.
